dmca.title: Sacramento Bee Complains of blogger's graphic use
dmca.body:
On Friday, Sept. 30, 2005, I faxed a formal notice of complaint regarding a copyright violation involving one of our staff graphics being used on blogger.com., one of your companies.

As of today, the graphic has not been removed from the site in question, which is:

http://livinginurbansac.blogspot.com/

The graphic shown on this page (attached) is copyrighted material from The Sacramento Bee. The artist, Olivia Nguyen, is a staff artist in our news graphics department.

The Bee does not allow online posting of copyrighted material, although the poster can link to sacbee.com, our web site.

We request that the improperly posted, copyrighted material be taken from the site immediately.

The link properties address of the graphic in question is:
http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/7564/1334/1

I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly infringing web pages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.

I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

[private]
Assistant Managing Editor/Visuals
The Sacramento Bee
[private]@sacbee.com

 
<hr>

The Sacramento Bee

Sept. 30, 2005

TO: Google, Inc.
ATTENTION: Blogger, DMCA complaints
1600 Amphitheatre Pkway
Mountain View, CA 94043

This is to call to your attention to an infringement of The Sacramento Bee copyright on this blogger.com page:

http://livinginurbansac.blogspot.com/

The graphic shown on this page (attached) is copyrighted material from The Sacramento Bee. The artist, Olivia Nguyen, is a staff artist in our news graphics department.

The Bee does not allow online posting of copyrighted material, although the poster can link to sacbee.com, our web site.

We request that the improperly posted, copyrighted material be taken from the site immediately.

The link properties address of the graphic in question is:
http://photos1.blogger.com/blogger/7564/1334/1600/927-0513details.jpg

I have a good faith belief that use of the copyrighted materials described above on the allegedly infringing web pages is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.

I swear, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notification is accurate and that I am the copyright owner or am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

[private]
Assistant Managing Editor/Visuals
The Sacramento Bee
